meanings.definition: A small piece or strip of paper, plastic, or other material attached to an object to identify it or give instructions.
meanings.sent1: I put tags on my luggage to make sure it doesn't get lost.
meanings.sent2: The tags on the plants at the garden show their names.
meanings.sent3: The tags on the toys made them look like they were playing dress-up.
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with tags, each one telling a different story.
meanings.sent5: The tags on the map helped us find our way through the forest.

meanings.definition: A label attached to someone or something for the purpose of identification or classification.
meanings.sent1: The tags on the shelves helped us find the books we needed.
meanings.sent2: The tags on the animals at the zoo had their names and species.
meanings.sent3: The tags on the clothes made them look like they were going to a fancy party.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like tags, revealing her emotions without words.
meanings.sent5: The tags on the keys made it easy to find the right one for the door.

meanings.definition: A game in which one player chases the others and tries to touch one of them, who then becomes the chaser.
meanings.sent1: We played tags in the park, running and laughing.
meanings.sent2: The children at the playground were playing tags with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The tags game turned into a hilarious race around the yard.
meanings.sent4: Laughter filled the air as they played tags under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The tags game made everyone feel energetic and happy.
